MS MCQs

    Work with data source limits (delegation limits) in a Power Apps canvas app

    »

    1. What happens when you delegate a function to a data source?

      Only the first 500 records return from the data source.

      The first 500 records process and then the matches are returned.

      The data source processes the function against all of the data and returns only the matches.

      A maximum of 2000 records return.


    2. What should you do when you see the warning triangle and blue line that delegation is not occurring?

      Adjust the row limit from 500 to 2000 records and then ignore the warning.

      Determine if the limited returned data will cause issues for the functionality of your app and design your app as appropriate.

      Ignore it, warnings are not a big deal and the user will know how to deal with the warning.

      Try a different function because Power Apps will not run if there are warnings.


    3. When combining delegable and non-delegable functions in a formula what happens?

      The data is only limited for the non-delegable portion, which in no way affects the delegable functions.

      You cannot combine delegable and non-delegable functions in the same formula.

      Power Apps will generate errors only if the app has more than 2000 records.

      The delegable functions may become non-delegable reducing the amount of data returned by the formula.
